Name: Statue of Nebsenet
Description: This stone statue,  coming from the Middle Kingdom belongs to Nebsenet, "Foreman(of workers)". He is represented standing on a socle, wearing a wig in the form bag. On his long kilt, draped under the breast and attached by the knot represented as overhanging, an offering formula is written in two columns, mentioning the name and title of the owner. The same text is found on the dorsal pillar, but badly damaged. The piece is quite roughly  carved, but presents all the characteristics of private statuary of the Middle Kingdom.
